page.title: 04Boat Building in Norham
page.content: Douglas and his son Ian Simpson continue Norhams tradition of building small open Angling and Salmon fishing boats. They build two types of Angling boat, one having a narrower stern than the other. These, as well as the Salmon coble which they also build, are of a very old design, being of clinker construction. The bottoms of the boats are built in Larch and the tops in white Pine, to make them lighter. The Simpsons have been building boats in Norham since 1904 and as well as this they are the local Joiners/ Undertakers. The boats are used on Salmon rivers all over the United Kingdom.
